title: High Waist R sans-serif with straight leg
content:
I am looking for sans-serif fonts where the\_R\_ has a high waist and straight leg similar to Nathaniel Winter-Hébert's Simon Sans as shown in this specimen

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SimonSansAsRPEBHSMWX_5855.jpg)
  [http://tendollarfonts.com/products/simon-sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/tendollarfonts.com/products/simon-sans "http://tendollarfonts.com/products/simon-sans")  
The font ID programs apparently do not check for this feature.

Thanks  
Don

Looking at your samples, shouldn’t Futura be on the list?

 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/galano-classic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/galano-classic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/galano-classic/")

 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/alpha/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/alpha/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/alpha/")

Some more: [Brown](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/lineto.com/The%20Fonts/Font%20Categories/Text%20Fonts/Brown), [Biko](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.dafont.com/biko.font), [Euclid Flex](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.swisstypefaces.com/fonts/euclid-flex) (borderline), [Alumia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/designyoutrust.com/2012/04/alumia-typeface-10) (by [Maarten Van 't Wout](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.behance.net/maartenvtw), used to be sold at TDF too but no-longer available anywhere...), [Nobel DTL](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/Nobel_rdrct.html) (borderline), [Chrysaora](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nonpareille/chrysaora), [English Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/english-grotesque), [Johnston](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/johnston) ITC, P22 [Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground-basic)/ [Johnston Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground), [Agenda](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/agenda), [Tschichold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/presencetypo/tschichold) (leg connection to bowl slightly curved), [Aperçu](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/apercu/about-font), [Germania](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/germania), [Boysen](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104338/http:/tendollarfonts.com/products/boysen) (see Tschichold)

Thanks Riccardo, for the additions.  
For the time being I am including fonts that are high-waisted in a less emphatic way than Simon-Sans and Baton, even though those are the prizes.

A tricky factor is that the more the leg sticks out, the more it suggests a high waist \_R\_, even the bowl is not shifted higher than usual. So careful examination is needed to determine if these fonts are actually high-waisted.
